entry.title: Welcome our Next Release 3.0 FP03 of PLM System Integration for SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Dear PLM community,

Change is a constant in life, yet one thing you can rely on is that we are constantly working on enhancing our add-on to ensure that you can enjoy regular improvements of our functions and usability. So I am happy to announce yet another feature pack of PLM System Integration for SAP S/4HANA. Curious to learn more? Here you go!

Enhanced Classification of Change Object, Document Version, and Vendor

You can now exchange classification information with an external PLM system using a new field Class Type: You can assign a received class to a change object, document version, or product version. For vendor data, you can now map class assignments and characteristics for inbound and outbound requests.

Local Substitutes for Bills of Material Under Version Control

PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA now allows you to create alternative groups in PEO bills of material under version control, based on information from a structure version substitute. Use the new Domain Model source structure Structure Version Substitutes Extension Fields <SUBSTITUTES-EXTENSION_FIELDS> and the new target structure Alternative version BOM item data </PLMS/S_ALT_MPES_VERSBOMITM_IN> to map attributes of substitutes. This structure allows you to set different values for the same SAP attributes for components and substitutes simultaneously.

Phantom Support for the Allocation of Production Operation List (POL) Components

The transfer of production operation lists has been enhanced: You can now transfer POLs that include component allocations of subassemblies which are marked as phantom to production routing. Assign phantom components to routing operations and transfer them for classic routing as well as PEO routing scenarios. This enhancement supports a more detailed and accurate management of bill of material (BOM) items. Ensure a precise allocation using successor keys to assign the actual leaf components of phantom items.

If materials are defined as Phantom using the special procurement type (SOBSL) in the material master, BOM components that contain this material are flagged as Phantom. Phantoms or components of phantom explosions can then be assigned during routing component assignment.

Additionally, this functionality supports suboperations: You can allocate leaf components of phantom items both at operation and suboperation level. Thus, you can effectively manage complex BOM structures, enjoying improved flexibility and accuracy during BOM component assignment.

Improved Product Structure Component Grouping

PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA now can handle the grouping of product structure components based on the group ID as an additional criterion for version-controlled bills of material.

The integration lets your SAP S/4HANA system consume an external grouping identifier to help control the grouping of BOM items for version BOMs. Two new standard grouping strategies are now available:

  • Strategy 1 groups items based on selectable criterial, for example, identical position number, material number, substitutes, model unit effectivity, and selection conditions.
  • Strategy 2 adds the group ID to the criteria of strategy 1.

 

Moreover, item grouping for classic bills of material has also been enhanced: You can now use the BAdI /PLMF/BD_SV_CUST_GROUPING to define your own, custom grouping criteria for the grouping of structure version items when creating an SAP classic BOM. Decide if you want to group classic BOM line items, for example, by position number and material number, or by the criteria you have defined via this BAdI. Enjoy this new flexibility and improve the quality of your master data, for more transparency and consistency.

 

What Else is New in PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA?

Besides the innovations above, we further improved your trusted PLMSI add-on to deliver you a range of new functions. Enjoy!

Improved Usability of the PLMSI Workbench

The usability of the PLMSI Workbench has been enhanced with new features: The new Search by Objects function lets you display Domain Model (DM) objects as the leading entity in your searches. You can search based on DM object type, business ID, or use the dynamic search help for suggestions. You can also filter search results by communication direction, DM request types, and object status.

A new Reload button in the toolbar updates selected data and adds new data that meets the initial selection criteria, without closing the current screen.

A new Enable Filter on Errors button in the toolbar allows you to filter entities in the tree based on their error status.

Business Content

As for each feature pack, we have updated our comprehensive set of business content (BC) sets to help you configure your system with ease. For details, see Initial Configuration.

For a comprehensive list of our new and enhanced features for release 3.0 FP03, check out our What's New Viewer. Please make sure to select the latest version 3.0 FP03 to filter for the most recent updates.

Expand Your Range

We are happy and proud that two members of our PLM system integration family have released new versions of their product:

PLM system integration, add-on for Autodesk Vault has published its new version 3.1. Check out the Release Notes (English) and Release Notes (German) to find out about all the new features.

PLM system integration, add-on for 3DEXPERIENCE has also published its new version, 3.2. To find out what is in it for you, refer to the Release Notes.

All relevant information on PLM system integration is also available via the links below.

  • SAP Help Portal
    • Documentation of PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Product Availability Matrix (SAP login required):
    • Matrix for PLM system integration 3.0 for SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Roadmap Explorer:
    • SAP Roadmap for PLM system integration

And last but not least ‚Äì contact us via our excellent forum if you have any questions.

entry.title: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release
entry.content:
Welcome to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release! The next release to help businesses unlock agility, intelligence, and resilience through Cloud ERP.

If you prefer watching rather than reading, you are welcome to check out my product update video, where I guide you through the content with my virtual twin.  

 

Figure 1: Check out my top highlights of the release in this video. 

The evolution of business capabilities via SAP Business AI will be a significant part of my personal release highlights. The arrival of SAP BDC, our Business Data Cloud (BDC) within our flagship ERP product SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition marks another highlight and brings the SAP flywheel to life.

And to be honest, I am particularly proud of the extensions we are now providing, built on the three-system landscape architecture, as the demand for more localizations have been articulated by many customers.

Over the years, we witnessed steady, linear growth that reflected our commitment to consistency and quality and a growing business scope. The new system architecture allowed us to enhance the scalability and flexibility for our customers, making it more adaptable. This shift was more than just a technical upgrade; it represented a transformation in the way our customers could approach own developments, deployment, and expansion and allowed our customers to better meet the needs of a growing user base and last-mile-individualization demand.  Building on this architecture, we now add new capabilities step-by-step.

 

Configuration localization tool now generally available

We are happy to announce the general availability of the configuration localization tool. This feature embedded in SAP Central Business Configuration is designed to streamline the creation of tailored customer local versions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for around further 160 countries and regions on top of the 60 standard local versions.

This tool is easy to use, empowering partners and customers to create new local versions efficiently. It provides localized configuration for a selected target country or region based on the settings of a source country or region - currently Germany.  This tool ensures localized configurations are generated consistently and life cycle compliant, a further project using available extensibility options can adopt to specific demands.

For further reference, you are welcome to check out my blog post on parallel line as the next evolution of our public cloud ERP product journey.

The general availability of the configuration localization tool opens the door for businesses to quickly and reliably expand into new markets with consistent configuration standards and tailored business processes.

Before we jointly investigate extended business capabilities, let‚Äôs explore, how SAP‚Äôs flywheel, combining fully integrated cloud applications, mission-critical data, and embedded AI, equipping enterprises to respond to macro-economic volatility, is coming to life.

 

BDC integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and initial list of data products

SAP S/4HANA Cloud PCE now supports Business Data Cloud (BDC) integration, offering a robust and scalable framework that enables seamless data exchange between SAP systems and external platforms. The solution is designed to unlock new levels of operational efficiency, agility, and insight across the enterprise.

BDC integration allows organizations to establish reliable connections between SAP S/4HANA Cloud PCE and a variety of external systems and databases. By automating the flow of data across these environments, companies can significantly reduce manual effort, minimize the risk of error, and shift their focus from routine maintenance to strategic action. The result is a more connected enterprise build on advanced analytics and processing capabilities, while maintaining the flexibility to work with a broader digital ecosystem.

At the core of this integration lies a rich and growing suite of data products, with an initial offering of approximately 36 available for use across departments and industries. These include financial accounting data that covers general ledger entries, accounts receivable and payable, and bank statements; sales and distribution data to improve order management and fulfillment; and material management data that supports real-time inventory control and procurement decisions. The human resources data offering helps manage employee information and recruiting metrics, while Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Insights allow organizations to better understand and serve their customers.

Additionally, businesses can leverage SAP Ariba Supplier Management profiles to strengthen vendor relationships, production planning records to enhance manufacturing efficiency, and retail and logistics analytics to refine distribution strategies. Project management metrics offer greater visibility into timelines, budgets, and outcomes, while compliance and audit reports help organizations stay proactive in meeting regulatory standards.

These data products collectively form a foundational layer for a next level of transformation. By combining them with BDC integration, organizations gain the ability to select and customize the data flows that are most relevant to their specific goals and processes and future-proof their operations via a truly connected, insight-driven enterprise. You will find more information here. 

 

What is on top of my business feature and AI list?

Simplify asset accounting

In the Finance domain, we‚Äôre elevating the user experience with AI-powered innovations that reshape how fixed asset data is interpreted and managed. A standout feature of this release is the introduction of AI-generated explanations for fixed asset key figures.

These insights, delivered in natural language, help users clearly understand the origins and calculations behind critical values such as depreciation and net book value. This reduces the effort and time required for data entry and onboarding, while improving accuracy and data governance through intuitive, user-friendly interfaces.

This release aligns with SAP's commitment to delivering efficient and user-centric solutions in asset accounting.

 

AI-assisted processing of incoming quality certificates with SAP Document AI

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we are introducing an innovation that brings generative AI directly into the core of quality management: SAP Document AI. This powerful, AI-driven feature automates and streamlines the handling of incoming quality certificates, unlocking efficiency gains for our customers.

One of the most powerful aspects of this solution is its seamless integration into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud experience. Delivered as a ready-to-use capability, SAP Document AI requires no custom development, offering customers an immediate path to value and a faster return on investment.

entry.title: The Next Industrial Revolution: AI Agents At The Heart Of Transformation
entry.content:
The manufacturing sector has always been at the forefront of innovation. From the steam engine to the assembly line, each leap has redefined what‚Äôs possible on the shop floor. Today, we stand at the threshold of another seismic shift‚Äîone powered not just by machines, but by intelligence itself.

The World Economic Forum‚Äôs latest whitepaper, ‚ÄúFrontier Technologies in Industrial Operations: The Rise of Artificial Intelligence Agents,‚Äù paints a compelling picture of this new era.

Why Now? The Case for Frontier Technologies

Industrial operations have long relied on innovations such as robotics and the industrial internet of things (IIoT) to drive productivity and efficiency. But the challenges facing manufacturers today are as complex as they are urgent. Labor shortages, rising costs, volatile supply chains, and the relentless push for sustainability are all converging. Manufacturers must not only optimize cost and efficiency but also adapt to rapid change, ensure resilience, and meet sustainability goals.

Traditional technologies, while powerful, are no longer enough to meet these demands. The answer lies in embracing what the WEF call ‚Äúfrontier technologies." Those that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible and unlock new forms of collaborative intelligence between humans and machines.

But why the focus on AI agents, and why now? The answer is simple: AI agents are not just another tool in the digital toolbox. They represent a new paradigm‚Äîone where software and robots can autonomously perceive, decide, and act, freeing up human workers to focus on creativity, strategy, and innovation.

The Rise of AI Agents: Virtual and Embodied

Success requires a leap beyond incremental improvement‚Äîtoward near-autonomous, AI-centric operations that empower people and machines to collaborate seamlessly.

The whitepaper highlights two main types of AI agents driving this transformation:

1. Virtual AI Agents: The Digital Workforce

Virtual AI agents operate within software environments. Think of them as digital colleagues‚Äîalways on, always learning, and capable of making decisions in real time. These agents can act as assistants, advisers, or even fully autonomous controllers, handling everything from production scheduling to predictive maintenance.

For example, a virtual AI agent might monitor a production line, identify bottlenecks, and automatically adjust workflows to optimize throughput. In supply chain management, these agents can analyze vast amounts of data, anticipate disruptions, and recommend alternative sourcing strategies‚Äîoften before a human would even notice a problem.

2. Embodied AI Agents: The New Robotics

Embodied AI agents take things a step further. These are robots equipped with advanced AI, capable of perceiving and interacting with the physical world. Unlike traditional robots, which are limited to repetitive, pre-programmed tasks, embodied AI agents can adapt to changing environments, handle complex assemblies, and even collaborate safely alongside human workers.

Picture a robot that can not only pick and place components but also recognize when a part is defective, adjust its grip, or reroute itself to avoid an obstacle‚Äîno manual intervention required. This is the promise of embodied AI: robotics that are as flexible and intuitive as the people working beside them.

Redefining the Human Role

One of the most exciting‚Äîand perhaps misunderstood‚Äîaspects of this transformation is the role of people.

Karim Lakhani, a professor at Harvard Business School, when asked, ‚ÄúWill AI replace humans?‚Äù, famously replied, ‚ÄúOf course AI won‚Äôt replace humans. But humans with AI will replace humans without AI.‚Äù

Far from replacing humans, AI agents are designed to augment human capabilities. As operations become more autonomous, the role of the worker evolves from hands-on operator to orchestrator and innovator.

Strategic Imperatives: Building the Foundations

Of course, realizing the full potential of AI agents requires more than just deploying new technology. Manufacturers must lay strong organizational and technological foundations:

  • Governance and Change Management: Leadership must champion the transformation, fostering a culture of innovation and trust.
  • Skills and Training: Upskilling and reskilling are essential, with a focus on digital literacy, data analysis, and collaboration.
  • Data and Infrastructure: High-quality, accessible data is the lifeblood of AI. Robust connectivity, cybersecurity, and scalable computing power are non-negotiable.
  • Ecosystem Collaboration: No company can do it alone. Partnerships across the value chain‚Äîsuppliers, technology providers, academia‚Äîare key to accelerating innovation.

Looking Ahead: From Experimentation to Transformation

The journey to AI-driven, near-autonomous operations is just beginning. Early adopters are already seeing tangible benefits, from reduced energy consumption to higher product quality and more resilient supply chains. But the real prize lies ahead: a future where manufacturers can respond to change with agility, drive sustainable growth, and empower their people like never before.

As the white paper concludes, manufacturers who embrace frontier technologies today will be the leaders of tomorrow. The Intelligent Age is here‚Äîare you ready to seize it?

Want to learn more about how AI-powered supply chains meet today‚Äôs needs while preparing for tomorrow? Check out this IDC Analyst Brief: ‚ÄúAI-Powered Business Suite for Supply Chain."

entry.title: Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
The 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contains enhancements to popular AI features and new natural language interaction options that help you work more intelligently and intuitively.

We‚Äôve spent the past 6 months since the 2502 release working with your feedback ‚Äì from beta programs, to roundtable discussions in the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum, to one-on-one meetings with customers ‚Äì to learn how we can help you achieve more with the help of AI in your system. Let‚Äôs take a look at what‚Äôs new, update you on the commercialization of some features, and give you resources for getting involved with our upcoming beta program. 

Natural language filtering now supports a wider range of queries

The AI-assisted easy filter (first released in 2502) enables you to filter list reports in your SAP Fiori elements-based apps using natural language. This simplifies how you access the information you need and reduces the training time required to pick up new applications delivered by SAP.

AI-assisted easy filter enables natural language filtering of pages with lists of business objects. Here the user can filter for a given sold-to party using plain language rather than needing to know its key..

For 2508, we‚Äôve made a number of enhancements to make interactions with AI-assisted easy filter even more intuitive:

  1. Tables can be filtered without needing to know an object‚Äôs specific key. Instead, simply enter the name of the object you are looking for. The AI-assisted easy filter will map that text to the intended key and apply it to the filter fields for you, which is a much more natural way to search for information. In the event that there are multiple keys with similar names, you will receive results filtered for those names. As before, you can always refine your results in the input field or using the classic filtering.
  2. We‚Äôve also worked to ensure parity between the filter fields that can be applied using the AI-assisted easy filter and the classic filter bar. Some users had reported that, in some cases, AI-assisted easy filter would not apply queries to certain filters. This was caused by the fact that some of the filter fields used navigation paths to different entities instead of the main entity for the app. This scenario is now supported and you can filter on any property present in the classic filter bar.

My Home Personalization with Insights Cards supports more apps and a new way to query for cards

The ability to create Insights cards and quickly add them to My Home now supports 20 SAP Fiori apps.

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards was released as a Joule capability as part of its 2503 release. The functionality allows end users to query Joule for business data they regularly need using natural language. The output is displayed as a card that can be added to their My Home page for easy reference. This makes it easier for users to access information they need to make everyday business decisions and move processes forward.

This functionality was initially limited to 9 applications. With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this coverage has been extended to 11 additional applications. This gives users easier and wider access to the business data that is important to them. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards now supports the following applications:

  1. Find Maintenance Order
  2. Find Maintenance Order and Operation
  3. Maintain Bill Of Material
  4. Manage Business Partner Master Data
  5. Manage Customer Returns
  6. Manage Manual Reservations
  7. Manage Material Coverage (Version 2)
  8. Manage Outbound Deliveries
  9. Manage Product Master Data
  10. Manage Purchase Orders (Version 2)
  11. Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional
  12. Manage Sales Orders
  13. Manage Sales Orders - Version 2
  14. Manage Sales Quotation - Version 2
  15. Manage Supplier Master Data
  16. Manage Usage Decisions
  17. Material Documents Overview
  18. Project Control - Enterprise Projects
  19. Reproceess Failed Material Movements
  20. Supplier Invoices List (Version 2)

Users can now use natural language to create and add Insights Cards directly in My Home.

For the 2508 release, we have also introduced a new way to create Insights cards using natural language: you can access the feature directly from My Home. This gives users the flexibility to choose the personalization option that works best for them, giving them access to the information they need at a glance.

If you'd like to read even more exciting updates about features and functionality included in the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, check out the following fantastic blogs from my colleagues:

  • For a general overview of new functionality: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release 
  • For a few more AI uses cases, some focused on particular business processes: Exploring AI and next-gen Cloud ERP innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 

Commercialization update: New Base AI includes common AI functions at no additional cost

For the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a number of AI solutions have been added to its Base AI offering. This means that you can use the features absolutely free of charge. You simply need to sign the SAP AI terms here and SAP will handle the activation for you.

Included in the Base AI offering for this release are AI-assisted easy filter and AI-assisted smart summarization, as well as AI-assisted enterprise search (which allows you to look up data from the search in My Home). Give them a try!

Try out upcoming AI innovations in the 2508 beta

For customers looking to try out the absolute latest in AI innovations, registration for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta is still open. This is your opportunity to try out and give feedback on new use cases for AI in your system. The solutions up for beta testing are free to use for the duration of the program.  Below is a preview of some of the features that will be available. Please note: Customer/partner participation will be at the discretion of the Beta Testing Program team. Participants must use SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition productively. Future developments are at the discretion of SAP and their details and delivery dates may be changed at any time.

Resolve situations directly in My Home without navigating to applications

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home allows you to quickly take action on business processes that need your attention directly in My Home..

The Situations tab in My Home provides quick summaries of business processes that need to be addressed in your system. Previously, this meant reading the alert on the tile, navigating to the required app(s), and making the required changes. With AI-assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home, we‚Äôre streamlining how you take action on these scenarios. You‚Äôll now be able to see a summary of the situation, start the relevant business process from quick actions on the card, and even make changes to the business data all without leaving your My Home page. This allows you to stay on top of your business and resolve potential issues even faster.

Streamline data entry in object pages

AI-assisted easy fill streamlines data entry by populating object pages based on natural language input (for example: emails or messages from colleagues).

Depending on your business scenario, SAP Fiori object pages can sometimes be quite complex. Data entry might mean filling a field at the top of the screen, scrolling for several sections to add more information, and so on. AI-assisted easy fill enables you to enter your updates into a single field using natural language. The solution then maps your input to the proper fields, highlights any potential inconsistencies that may need to be addressed, and ‚Äì after your review ‚Äì updates the fields. This will help speed up data entry and reduce training time for new users.

Resolve error messages with AI assistance

AI-assisted error explanation provides resolution recommendations to error and warning messages in your system.

Learning new business processes can be tricky. AI-assisted error explanation uses AI to generate explanations and suggest resolutions for errors that are triggered in your system. This streamlines how you handle errors and reduces training time, making you more productive and helping you pick up processes even faster; in addition to reducing your organization‚Äôs support load.

Search for applications you need using natural language

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications allows you to search for applications using natural language.

When learning a new business process or stepping into a new role, it can sometimes be challenging to find the exact application you need to carry out a task. With AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications, you can search for the app you need using natural language. Simply type in what you need to do and get served the required application, which you can add to your My Home page with a single click. This allows you to access the applications you need without needing to know the exact application name.

We want to hear from you!

Whether you take advantage of the new free features in the Base AI package, subscribe to cutting edge technologies, or choose to take part in a beta program; we want to hear what you think about these solutions! Give them a try and share your feedback below or with the product team. Your experience is critical to understanding how we can make these innovations even better for you.

When you‚Äôre ready to get involved, you can:

  1. Register to use base AI features
  2. Sign up for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta
  3. Join the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum (for customers live on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

Happy experimenting! We‚Äôll be back with another update for the 2602 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

This release introduces a groundbreaking feature: SAP Document AI. The generative AI-powered document processing capability revolutionizes the way businesses manage and process quality certificates, handling them in all formats seamlessly within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Designed to extract relevant information and automatically identify corresponding quality certificates, this solution empowers businesses to streamline their processes and achieve remarkable operational efficiencies.



Leveraging generative AI with SAP Document AI

With the launch of the SAP Document AI capability in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, businesses can now enjoy a new advantage in processing quality certificates. The innovation empowers users to enhance productivity in processing quality certificates while reducing production loss attributable to material inspection delays.

By harnessing the power of generative AI, this feature reduces the time required to process incoming certificates, thereby allowing quality technicians to concentrate on their core functions. This effectively reduces manual effort and associated processing costs. Furthermore, the automation provided by SAP Document AI ensures that no certificates are lost or overlooked, augmenting quality control mechanisms and minimizing errors due to improperly assigned objects.

Through efficient extraction and structuring of information from various quality certificates, SAP Document AI streamlines stock release processes with quicker quality certificate confirmation. The AI-driven solution facilitates the automatic extraction of data from paper or PDF quality certificates, transferring the extracted data into a smart processing queue for seamless handling. Whether through automated processing or intelligent error management, the executed transactions are both reliable and agile.

 

Streamlining certificate management processes

Beyond its AI capabilities, the innovation also introduces application-level improvements that enhance inbound logistics workflows.. By instantly generating certificate receipt confirmation using extracted data, the system ensures a swift and reliable integration of quality certificates into the workflow. Application data is utilized to accurately locate the corresponding quality certificate data records within the SAP system, and these records are efficiently mapped to the quality certificates in the queue. This functionality further enhances the accuracy and efficiency of the document management process

Certificates receive a status update to "received," with the quality certificate document being attached to the relevant system data record. The solution also provides enhanced flexibility, enabling customers to transfer defects to a variety of quality notifications seamlessly.

 

 

AI-powered document processing for incoming supplier quality certificates

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release marks a significant milestone in the digital evolution of quality certificate processing. By integrating generative AI technology into business processes, the AI-powered document processing for incoming supplier quality certificates elevates productivity, accuracy, and reliability while reducing the time and effort involved in managing quality certificates.
